rows.text_1:
Children learn best by playing and doing. 

Let’s see how {F1_FATHER} helps his children learn different skills through playing.

rows.text_2:
**{F1_FATHER}**: “Gently throw the ball using the inside of your hands, like this.”

**{F1_SON_5}**: “I want to do it now!!”

**{F1_DAUGHTER_6}**: “No, I want to do it first!!”

**{F1_FATHER}**: “It can be hard to wait, but we cannot all go first. {F1_DAUGHTER_6}, how do you think we could take turns throwing the ball?** 

**{F1_DAUGHTER_6}**: “Let’s make a circle! I will throw the ball to {F1_SON_5}, then he throws it to you {F1_FATHER}, and you throw it back to me!”

**{F1_SON_5}**: “Yes, that sounds great!”

**{F1_FATHER}**: “That’s a fantastic idea, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}! Let’s give it a try!”
**{F1_FATHER}**: “Well done, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}! You took the lead, and we all had so much fun taking turns! {F1_SON_5}, you were also great at patiently waiting for your turn.”

rows.text_1: {F1_FATHER} helped his children learn by playing with them. Let’s explore how he did this.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Yes, he showed them how to kick the ball, and helped them learn other skills as well - all by playing!
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: Yes, he involved them in solving a problem, and helped them learn other skills as well - all by playing!
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Yes, he supported them to learn to take turns, and helped them learn other skills as well - all by playing!
rows.quiz_1_feedback_4: Yes, he helped them practise being patient, and supported them to learn other skills as well - all by playing!
rows.quiz_1_feedback_5: Yes, he invited them to take the lead, and helped them learn other skills as well - all by playing!
rows.quiz_2_question: **How did {F1_FATHER} help his children learn these skills?**
rows.quiz_2_feedback_1: Exactly! Their play time together had so many opportunities to learn new skills.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_2: Exactly! Their play time together had so many opportunities to learn new skills.
rows.quiz_2_option_3_text: By asking for their ideas and solutions
rows.quiz_2_feedback_3: Exactly! Their play time together had so many opportunities to learn new skills.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_4: Exactly! Their play time together had so many opportunities to learn new skills.

rows.text_1:
Children (just like us) can learn a lot from their mistakes.

Let’s look at how {F3_UNCLE} supports {F3_DAUGTHER_7} to learn from her mistake when she plays a bit too rough indoors.

rows.text_2:
**{F3_UNCLE}**: “{F3_DAUGHTER_7}, watch where you’re going! You’re going to break something.” 

**{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: “No I won’t!”
*{F3_DAUGHTER_7} runs into a table and breaks a vase. {F3_UNCLE} sees and is concerned.*

**{F3_UNCLE}**: “Are you hurt??”

**{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: “No, {F3_UNCLE}. I’m so, so sorry for breaking the vase… I didn’t see it.”

**{F3_UNCLE}**: “Thank you for realising your mistake and apologising. Do you know how you could have prevented that from happening?”

**{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: “Yes, I should have listened. I continued running even after you warned me.”

**{F3_UNCLE}**: “It’s OK, {F3_DAUGHTER_7}. I’m proud that you are able to learn from your mistakes. Let’s get a broom to sweep up the pieces. We may be able to repair the vase with some glue.”

**{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: “Okay…”

rows.text_1: Let’s look at how {F3_UNCLE} helped {F3_DAUGHTER_7} learn from her mistake!
rows.quiz_1_option_1_text: He gives an instruction to prevent the mistake
rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Yes, he warns her in order to avoid the mistake.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: Yes, when your child makes a mistake it is important to stay calm.
rows.quiz_1_option_3_text: He shows he cares most about {F3_DAUGHTER_7}
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Yes, when the accident happens, he first asks if {F3_DAUGHTER_7} is okay!
rows.quiz_1_option_4_text: He thanks {F3_DAUGHTER_7} for recognising her mistake
rows.quiz_1_feedback_4: Yes, praise helps our children to take more responsibility for their actions next time.
rows.quiz_1_option_5_text: He asks {F3_DAUGHTER_7} to reflect on her behaviour
rows.quiz_1_feedback_5: Yes, he helps her learn by asking her how she could have prevented the mistake.
rows.quiz_2_option_1_text: It is okay to make mistakes
rows.quiz_2_feedback_1: Exactly! {F3_DAUGHTER_7} learns important things because {F3_UNCLE} responds in a calm and supportive way.
rows.quiz_2_option_2_text: I am still loved even if I make mistakes
rows.quiz_2_feedback_2: Exactly! {F3_DAUGHTER_7} learns important things because {F3_UNCLE} responds in a calm and supportive way.
rows.quiz_2_option_3_text: I can learn from my mistakes
rows.quiz_2_feedback_3: Exactly! {F3_DAUGHTER_7} learns important things because {F3_UNCLE} responds in a calm and supportive way.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_4: Exactly! {F3_DAUGHTER_7} learns important things because {F3_UNCLE} responds in a calm and supportive way.
rows.quiz_1_option_6_text: He involves {F3_DAUGHTER_7} to resolve the situation together
rows.quiz_1_feedback_6: Yes, by asking her to help clean up, he shows how she can make things right again after making a mistake.
rows.quiz_2_option_5_text: I can help to make things right again
rows.quiz_2_feedback_5: Exactly! {F3_DAUGHTER_7} learns important things because {F3_UNCLE} responds in a calm and supportive way.
